summary: The Veterans Claims Quality Improvement Act of 2025 aims to improve the quality and efficiency of the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) in processing veterans' benefits claims. It mandates the VA to address avoidable deferrals, study and report on inconsistencies in the Office of General Counsel opinions, and implement programs to assure quality in decisions made by the Board of Veterans' Appeals, including training, performance reviews, and data analysis. The bill also requires increased transparency through annual reports on the Board's decisions and plans for improvements, including improved processing of remanded claims.
